intro: Chavica mullesua, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with five petals and a distinctive tubular shape. Chavica mullesua is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
